definition: (of a body of water) free from disturbance by heavy waves, the act of smoothing, make (a surface) shine
details:
adjective
- (of a body of water) free from disturbance by heavy waves
= synonyms: quiet
- lacking obstructions or difficulties
= example: lacking obstructions or difficulties
- smoothly agreeable and courteous with a degree of sophistication
= synonyms: politic, suave, bland
- smooth and unconstrained in movement
= example: smooth and unconstrained in movement
= synonyms: fluent
- having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges or irregularities
= example: having a surface free from roughness or bumps or ridges or irregularities
- of motion that runs or flows or proceeds without jolts or turbulence
= example: of motion that runs or flows or proceeds without jolts or turbulence
- of the margin of a leaf shape
= synonyms: rough
- (music) without breaks between notes
= example: (music) without breaks between notes
= synonyms: legato
noun
- the act of smoothing
= example: the act of smoothing
verb
- make (a surface) shine
= synonyms: shine, polish, smoothen
- make smooth or smoother, as if by rubbing
= example: make smooth or smoother, as if by rubbing
= synonyms: smoothen
- free from obstructions
= example: free from obstructions
= synonyms: smooth out
